summary: This is an email chain from November 23, 2021, discussing FOIA requests related to Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and death. It involves coordination between a U.S. Attorney's Office and the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) regarding contact information for Mark Epstein and his attorney, Stacey Richman, to facilitate the release of records.

persons.name: Mark Epstein
persons.role: Brother of Jeffrey Epstein / FOIA correspondent
persons.context: The Bureau of Prisons (BOP) is trying to contact him regarding his prior communications about FOIA requests for records related to Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and death, but he has not been responsive.

persons.name: Stacey Richman
persons.context: Identified as Mark Epstein's lawyer who is described as 'usually very responsive.' The email suggests contacting her as an alternative method to reach Mark Epstein regarding the FOIA matter.

connections.description: Stacey Richman is identified as the lawyer for Mark Epstein in the context of handling FOIA requests related to Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: FOIA Requests Spike After Times Article
events.description: Following a New York Times article about Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and death, the Bureau of Prisons receives multiple new FOIA requests from media outlets (ABC, CNN, MuckRack). BOP plans to quickly release the same records previously disclosed.

keyFacts: A New York Times article published on or before November 23, 2021, about Epstein's incarceration and death triggered a new wave of FOIA requests to the Bureau of Prisons.
The Bureau of Prisons was attempting to contact Mark Epstein regarding his prior communications about the FOIA matter but had been unable to reach him.
Stacey Richman is identified as Mark Epstein's attorney and is suggested as a responsive point of contact for the FOIA issue.
